doc.previous: There are seven state parks within the confines of New York City, including Clay Pit Ponds State Park Preserve, a natural area which includes extensive riding trails, and Riverbank State Park, a 28-acre (110,000Â m2) facility that rises 69 feet (21Â m) over the Hudson River.[176]
